title: LexisNexis® Announces Integrated Coplogic™ Solutions Suite for Law Enforcement
text:
LexisNexis Risk Solutions 
ATLANTA -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- LexisNexis ® Risk Solutions today announced the official launch of its Coplogic ™ Solutions suite, integrating incident and accident reporting capabilities for law enforcement agencies. Coplogic Solutions integrates LexisNexis ® eCrash with the capabilities attained through three recent strategic company acquisitions – Coplogic, iyeTek and PoliceReports.US – to create significant time and resource efficiency improvement for law enforcement agencies through online citizen self-reporting and other technology-enabled solutions, while expanding services to the community. 
“These integrated capabilities eliminate manual, time consuming processes and allow agencies to reallocate resources and proactively address community needs while improving incident and crash report accuracy,” said Roy Marler, Vice President, LexisNexis Risk Solutions. “The acquisitions we have made were essential in providing this complete functionality. Coplogic offered citizen self-reporting solutions to law enforcement agencies across the U.S. and Canada; iyeTek provided fully automated crash reporting, design and electronic citations; and PoliceReports.US enabled improved access to public auto crash report data. The combination offers a comprehensive platform for report capture, management, processing and distribution.” 
The Coplogic Solutions portfolio enables: Significant time savings for agencies and community members Easy integration with existing records management systems (RMS) Expanded services to the community and local businesses Enhanced officer and public safety Improved handling of community needs 
Several law enforcement agencies are already taking advantage of the integrated capabilities, including Sterling Heights (MI) Police Department, University of North Texas, Norfolk (VA) Police Department, St. Petersburg (FL) Police Department, Fremont (CA) Police Department, Orlando (FL) Police Department, West Jordan (UT) Police Department, Hayward (CA) Police Department and Miami Dade (FL) Police Department.
